item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 29, 2025 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. An analysis of DeepSeek's R1-Zero and R1 (230 points | 101 comments)
2. SmolGPT: A minimal PyTorch implementation for training a small LLM from scratch (89 points | 13 comments)
3. Dead Games (41 points | 10 comments)
4. Making the Video That Made Gorillaz (8 points | discuss)
5. Building a T1D smartwatch for my son from scratch (54 points | 8 comments)
6. OpenAI says it has evidence DeepSeek used its model to train competitor (230 points | 912 comments)
7. Ötzi the Lyme Mummy (2019) (50 points | 13 comments)
8. Think your dog can understand words? This scientist says you might be right (25 points | 17 comments)
9. I still like Sublime Text (893 points | 479 comments)
10. Bacteria (and Their Metabolites) and Depression (352 points | 153 comments)
11. Case Study: ByteDance Uses eBPF to Enhance Networking Performance (65 points | 7 comments)

13. Society for Technical Communication to permanently close its doors (57 points | 13 comments)
14. Frigade (YC W23) is hiring engineer #2 ( | hide)
15. Waymo to test its autonomous driving technology in over 10 new cities (63 points | 29 comments)

17. Asteroid Impact on Earth 2032 with Probability 1% and 8Mt Energy (80 points | 94 comments)
18. Astral – "We're building a new static type checker for Python" (154 points | 60 comments)
19. DeepSeek R1 Is Now Available on Azure AI Foundry and GitHub (15 points | 2 comments)
20. Intel doesn't know how to be a foundry," Tim Cook reportedly told TSMC's CEO (119 points | 69 comments)
21. Fed leaves rates unchanged, drops reference to inflation 'progress' (21 points | 9 comments)
22. A story about restoring and upgrading a Commodore Amiga 1000 (100 points | 27 comments)
23. Google Pixel 4a's old firmware is gone, trapping users on buggy battery update (198 points | 159 comments)
24. Seagate: 'new' hard drives used for tens of thousands of hours (274 points | 164 comments)
25. Effective AI code suggestions: less is more (35 points | 10 comments)
26. Preserves: An Expressive Data Language (63 points | 25 comments)
27. Show HN: Mcp-Agent – Build effective agents with Model Context Protocol (22 points | 2 comments)
28. Integration of 1,024 silicon quantum dots with on-chip electronics (9 points | discuss)
29. Adding concurrent read/write to DuckDB with Arrow Flight (71 points | 20 comments)
30. DeepSeek's Hidden Bias: How We Cut It by 76% Without Performance Loss (81 points | 62 comments)
